overview.short: Arcanobacterium species are Gram-positive, facultatively anaerobic or aerobic pleomorphic rods, historically grouped with coryneform bacteria.
overview.clinical_context: Associated with pharyngitis, skin and soft tissue infections, and occasionally invasive disease.

field_notes.Shape: Often described as pleomorphic or coryneform rods on microscopy.
field_notes.Haemolysis: Many species show beta haemolysis on blood agar.
field_notes.Catalase: Catalase-negative, helping differentiate from some coryneform genera.

key_differentiators.notes: Beta haemolysis supports Arcanobacterium over most Corynebacterium species.
Catalase negativity helps separate from catalase-positive coryneforms.

common_confusions.reason: Similar pleomorphic Gram-positive rods and overlapping biochemical profiles.
Historical taxonomic overlap and similar haemolytic behavior.

when_to_question_identification: Non-haemolytic isolates may fit Corynebacterium better.
Strict anaerobic growth is inconsistent with Arcanobacterium.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Useful for presumptive identification of haemolytic species.
Commonly used for identification of coryneform and related Gram-positive rods.
